info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:46PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mesa County through 515 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fruita, or 12 miles west of Grand Junction, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fruita around 505 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 8 and 24. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
